newsitem.title: JAPAN: Nippon Oil to lower April product wholesale prices.
newsitem.headline: Nippon Oil to lower April product wholesale prices.

text.p: Nippon Oil Co Ltd said on Thursday it would cut the wholesale price of its oil products by 1.8 yen per litre, effective April 1.
As a result of the cut, the wholesale price of gasoline will be 91.2 yen per litre and 69.5 yen for gas oil, including tax, the leading refiner said.
Kerosene, which is not taxed at the wholesale stage, will be 37.4 yen per litre, the refiner said.
The cut in April prices reflects a fall in the price of February-loading crude and a planned reduction in the import tariff on crude oil, Nippon Oil said.
Under a long-term programme, the Japanese government has decided to lower the import tariff on crude oil to 215 yen per kilolitre from fiscal 1997/98 starting on April 1, from 315 yen at present.
